content.text: Work out the total journey time from London to Marseille
Give your answer in hours and minutes
The distance from London to Ashford is \(90\mathrm{km}\)
The local time in London is the same as the local time in Ashford
Work out the average speed, in km/h, of the train between London and Ashford
During the journey, the train takes 35 seconds to completely cross a bridge
The average speed of the train during this crossing is \(90\mathrm{km / h}\)
The length of the train is 95 metres
Calculate the length, in metres, of this bridge
For the **standard fare**, write the ratio adult fare : child fare in its simplest form
For an **adult**, find the percentage increase in the cost of the standard fare to the premier fare
For one journey from London to Marseille, the ratio
number of adults : number of children = 11 : 2
There were 220 adults in total on this journey
All of the children and \(70\%\) of the adults paid the standard fare
The remaining adults paid the premier fare
Calculate the total of the fares paid by the adults and the children
The fares for the train journey are shown in the table below
There were \(3.08 \times 10^{5}\) passengers that made this journey in 2018
This was a \(12\%\) decrease in the number of passengers that made this journey in 2017
Find the number of passengers that made this journey in 2017
Give your answer in standard form
Here is part of a train timetable for a journey from London to Marseille
All times given are in local time
The local time in Marseille is 1 hour ahead of the local time in London
Solve
Find the integer values of \(n\) that satisfy this inequality
Simplify
triangle \(A\) after a translation by the vector \(\begin{pmatrix} - 3 \\ 2 \end{pmatrix}\),
triangle \(A\) after a reflection in the line \(y = x\)
On the grid, draw the image of
Describe fully the single transformation that maps triangle \(A\) onto triangle \(B\)
Find the matrix that represents an enlargement, scale factor \(- 2\), centre \((0, 0)\)
\(\begin{pmatrix} & \\ & \end{pmatrix}\)
Calculate the determinant of the matrix in part (c)(i)
Show that the volume of the bowl is \(368 \mathrm{cm}^3\), correct to the nearest \(\mathrm{cm}^3\)
[The volume, \(V\), of a sphere with radius \(r\) is \(V = \frac{4}{3}\pi r^3\).]
The tin is completely full of soup
When all the soup is poured into the empty bowl, \(80\%\) of the volume of the bowl is filled
Calculate the radius of the tin
The diagram shows a hemispherical bowl of radius \(5.6\mathrm{cm}\) and a cylindrical tin of height \(10\mathrm{cm}\)
Calculate the total surface area of the cone
[The curved surface area, \(A\), of a cone with radius \(r\) and slant height \(l\) is \(A = \pi r l\).]
The cone contains salt to a depth of 4.5 cm
The top layer of the salt forms a circle that is parallel to the base of the cone
The diagram shows a cone with radius \(1.75 \mathrm{cm}\) and height \(6 \mathrm{cm}\)
Use the graph to find
On the grid opposite, draw a suitable straight line to solve the equation
By drawing a suitable tangent, find an estimate of the gradient of the curve at \(x = -2\)
Complete the table for \(y = \mathrm{g}(x)\) where \(\mathrm{g}(x) = 2^{-x}\) for \(-3 \leqslant x \leqslant 3\)
On the grid opposite, draw the graph of \(y = \mathrm{g}(x)\)
Use your graph to find the positive solution to the equation \(\mathrm{f}(x) = \mathrm{g}(x)\)
The diagram shows the graph of \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\) where \(\mathrm{f}(x) = x^{2} - \frac{2}{x} - 2, x \neq 0.\)
Calculate an estimate of the mean time
On the grid, complete the histogram to show the information in the frequency table
The table shows the time, \(t\) seconds, taken by each of 120 boys to solve a puzzle
Find the equation of the line \(AC\) in the form \(y = mx + c\)
Calculate the acute angle between \(AC\) and the \(x\)-axis
Find the equation of the line \(BD\) in the form \(y = mx + c\)
The diagonals \(AC\) and \(BD\) intersect at \((- 0.5, 3)\)
Work out the co-ordinates of \(D\)
\(ABCD\) is a kite, where \(AC\) is the longer diagonal of the kite
\(B\) is the point (3.5, 2)
A straight line joins the points \(A \left(- 2, - 3\right)\) and \(C \left(1, 9\right)\)
Complete the following statement
The probability that Angelo takes two black counters is
The probability that Angelo takes two black counters is \(\frac{7}{15}\)
Angelo has a bag containing 3 white counters and \(x\) black counters
He takes two counters at random from the bag, without replacement
Solve by factorisation
Write down the number of black counters in the bag
Show that \(AC = 76.7 \text{m}\), correct to 1 decimal place
Calculate \(BD\)
In the diagram, \(BC\) is a vertical wall standing on horizontal ground \(AB\)
\(D\) is the point on \(AB\) where \(AD = 58 \text{m}\)
The angle of elevation of \(C\) from \(A\) is \(26^{\circ}\)
The angle of elevation of \(C\) from \(D\) is \(72^{\circ}\)
Calculate \(EF\)
A different triangle \(PQR\) also has an area of \(70 \text{m}^2\)
\(PQ:QR = 1:2\) and \(PQ = EF\)
Find angle \(PQR\)
Triangle \(EFG\) has an area of \(70 \text{m}^2\)
\(EF:FG = 1:2\) and angle \(EFG = 40^\circ\)
Write down the next two terms of the sequence
Find the \(n\)th term of this sequence
Find the value of \(n\) when the \(n\)th term is \(- 65\)
Another sequence has \(n\)th term \(2n^{2} + 5n - 15.\)
Find the difference between the 4th term and the 5th term of this sequence
